title: Cough syrup deaths: another child from Madhya Pradesh dies during treatment in Nagpur
content: Chhindwara Additional Collector Dhirendra Singh said the child had been admitted in Nagpur since September 14 but her condition did not improve

title: Lack of structure harmed us in 2024, says newly appointed Haryana Congress chief
content: Narender Singh told The Hindu that strengthening the organisation in the State and expanding it to the booth and village levels were his priorities

title: Balancing lives and conservation
content: Kerala amends wildlife laws to tackle rising human-wildlife conflicts while raising concerns over ecological impact

title: 'We don't interfere': Moscow on Trump‚Äôs Russian oil claims; calls its supplies vital for India
content: Russian ambassador Denis Alipov on Thursday stated that India's oil import decisions are driven by its national interests, responding to claims by US President Donald Trump. New Delhi has reaffirmed its independent energy sourcing approach, emphasising the importance of Russian oil for its economy and consumer welfare amidst global volatility.

title: Dramatic twist: In ASI suicide case, FIR names IPS officer's wife
content: Rohtak police registered an FIR for abetment to suicide and criminal conspiracy against four individuals, including the wife and brother-in-law of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, following ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather's suicide. Lather accused Kumar of corruption in a final video before his death. The FIR was lodged after Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini assured justice to Lather's family.

title: 'Will take countersteps': China warns 'bully' US; defends buying Russian oil
content: China defended its "legitimate" Russian oil purchases, accusing the US of "unilateral bullying" and "economic coercion." Beijing warned of countermeasures if its interests are harmed, emphasising national sovereignty. This comes after US President Donald Trump claimed that India would stop buying Russian oil and signalled pressure on China as well.

title: ‚ÄòAnaesthesia of death‚Äô: How Bengaluru doctor‚Äôs 'cure' killed his dermatologist wife
content: A Bengaluru surgeon stands accused of murdering his wife, a dermatologist, by administering a fatal anaesthetic overdose. Initially ruled an unnatural death, an autopsy report confirmed the presence of Propofol, transforming the case into a cold-blooded murder investigation. The accused allegedly attempted to conceal his wife's death and prevent an autopsy.

title: Kohli's viral post: 'Awkward' truth revealed - 'The only time you truly fail'
content: The Indian cricket team arrived in Perth for their ODI series against Australia, with Virat Kohli's cryptic social media post initially sparking speculation about his future. However, the message was revealed to be a brand promotion, shifting focus back to his on-field preparations alongside Rohit Sharma during a training session.

title: Bezos' ex-wife cuts Amazon share; slashes stake by $12.6B; Increases charity
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, cutting holdings by nearly 42% to $12.6 billion. This reduction occurred despite Amazon's stock performance and follows her extensive philanthropic efforts, which have heavily focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. The exact reasons for the stake reduction, whether sales or donations, remain unspecified.

title: Bihar polls: Yogi flays RJD, Cong for 'big fuss' over burqa
content: The UP CM's remarks came during a rally in Danapur near Patna, held in support of BJP candidate and former Union minister Ram Kripal Yadav, who filed his nomination papers earlier in the day.

title: Zerodha CEO's X hacked: Nithin Kamath falls for phishing email; AI attack bypasses 2FA
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's X account was briefly hacked via a sophisticated phishing email, despite two-factor authentication. He clicked a fake password change link, allowing attackers to post scam content. Kamath highlighted that even tech-savvy individuals can fall victim to AI-driven attacks, stressing human error as cybersecurity's persistent vulnerability.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 ends above 25,550; BSE Sensex up 860 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went above 25,600 intra-day, BSE Sensex soared over 1,000 points during trading hours.

title: 'Will he put us in jail?' BJP slams Priyank Kharge for RSS remarks; dares action
content: Union minister Shobha Karandlaje defended the RSS against Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge's remarks, calling it an "unshakeable" organization. Kharge had urged action against government officials attending RSS events and speaking against the Congress government, citing civil service conduct rules. He stated that show-cause notices have been issued and suspensions are imminent for officials violating neutrality rules.

title: Ind vs Pak: Varun takes a dig at Mohsin Naqvi ‚Äì ‚ÄòBas Cup cheen sakte hai‚Äô
content: Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy revealed his unique 'coffee cup' celebration after India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan. Initially planning to sleep with the trophy, he settled for a mug after the team's triumph. Chakravarthy emphasized that the cup's absence didn't diminish their champion status, as India remains the world's number one team.

title: Introspection mode: Zoho founder to take break; warns of this risk
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.

title: Modi in Andhra: PM offers prayers at Srisailam Temple; to inaugurate key projects
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi offered prayers at the Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Swamy Varla Devasthanam in Srisailam, accompanied by Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu. The visit precedes the inauguration of development projects worth Rs 13,430 crore in Kurnool, spanning various crucial sectors. The PM will also visit a memorial dedicated to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

title: Diwali 2025: Festival calendar, dates, significance and muhurat guide
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of good over evil and knowledge over ignorance. Celebrated over five days starting October 18, 2025, it honors Lord Rama's return and Goddess Lakshmi's blessings. The main Lakshmi Puja occurs on October 20, with specific auspicious timings for prayers.

title: Hijab flashpoints across India: Classrooms to courtrooms; faith vs uniformity
content: From Kerala to Uttar Pradesh, recent hijab-related controversies in Indian schools and colleges have reignited national debate over religious freedom and institutional dress codes. Incidents include students being barred from class, alleged coercion, and police involvement. These cases, spanning Kerala, Jharkhand, Karnataka, and UP, have prompted legal petitions, official inquiries, and public outcry. They highlight the ongoing tension between individual rights and uniform policies, with parents, educators, and authorities responding differently in each instance.

title: From job offer to battlefield: Hyderabad man lured to Russia; forced to fight against Ukraine
content: A 37-year-old Hyderabad man, Mohammed Ahmed, was allegedly defrauded by a job agent and sent to Russia, where he was reportedly drafted into fighting the war against Ukraine. After jumping from an army vehicle to evade combat and injuring his leg, he is now being threatened to fight or face death.

title: When and where Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will train in Australia
content: India's ODI cricket team has arrived in Australia for a three-match series, featuring stars like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma under new captain Shubman Gill. This marks their first international appearance since the Champions Trophy win. The series begins Sunday in Perth, with subsequent matches in Adelaide and Sydney, followed by a T20 series.

title: 50% US tariffs: Indian refiners look to cut back on Russian crude imports
content: India is reportedly planning to gradually reduce its Russian oil imports, a move influenced by US pressure and tariffs. While refiners await official directives, the government prioritizes stable energy prices and supply security. Discussions are ongoing with the US for enhanced energy cooperation, potentially impacting trade agreements and tariff rates.

title: Now loading! Very poor air: Delhi-NCR AQI worsens within ‚Äòpoor‚Äô category
content: Delhi's air quality worsened to the 'poor' category on Wednesday, with pollution models predicting it will turn 'very poor' before Diwali. Stubble burning's contribution to PM2.5 is expected to rise, accelerating deterioration. Noida breached the 'very poor' mark, recording the country's worst AQI for the day.

title: Veteran singer Balasaraswathi Devi passes away at 97, tributes pour in
content: Veteran actress and playback singer R. Balasaraswathi Devi, a pioneer in Telugu cinema, has passed away at 97. Her career, spanning over 2,000 songs and significant contributions to classical music in films, left an indelible mark. Leaders, including Telangana CM Revanth Reddy and Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, mourned her loss, acknowledging her irreplaceable contribution to the arts.

title: Ricky Hatton‚Äôs final moments revealed as inquest confirms cause of death
content: Former boxing champion Ricky Hatton was found dead at his Manchester home on September 14, 2025, by his manager. The inquest confirmed his cause of death was hanging. Hatton was preparing for a comeback fight in Dubai, 13 years after his last professional bout. His family last saw him two days prior, reporting he was in good spirits.

title: 'When you decide to give up': Kohli shares vague social media post
content: The Indian cricket team, led by Shubman Gill, arrived in Perth after travel delays for a series against Australia. Virat Kohli posted an inspirational message after the team's arrival, with the upcoming ODI series marking a potential last tour Down Under for him and Rohit Sharma, who have focused solely on ODIs.

title: What is Wanasah Kids? Meet the channel every parent in the Arab world wants on TV
content: Al-Farah & Entertainment Channel launches in 2025 with an updated frequency, offering a full-family viewing experience. Known for its safe and educational content, Wanasah TV, featuring the popular character Lulu, provides engaging "edutainment" for children. The channel is free, broadcasts 24/7, and is easily accessible via satellite.

title: MP shocker: Man shoots, beheads cousin over 'affair' with his wife
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Sagar district where a 28-year-old man was brutally murdered and beheaded by his cousin and family. Suspecting an illicit affair, the attackers allegedly shot and then dismembered the victim. The victim's brother was also shot while attempting to intervene and is in critical condition.

title: 'Cowards': India cricketer slams trolls for going after KBC Junior kid
content: A fifth-grader's appearance on Kaun Banega Crorepati sparked online backlash for his assertive demeanor.  Despite facing criticism, cricketer Varun Chakaravarthy defended the young contestant, calling out online abuse. The incident highlights the pressures on child participants and the harsh realities of social media scrutiny.

title: Ditch these common bathroom mistakes to keep your digestion and gut healthy -
content: Your bathroom habits can impact your gut health. Experts warn that prolonged sitting, straining, and using smartphones can disrupt digestion. Simple changes like reducing toilet time and avoiding distractions can improve gut function. Paying attention to warning signs of gut problems is crucial. Making mindful adjustments promotes long-term digestive wellness.

title: 'Priority to safeguard interests': MEA reacts to Trump's claim on Russian oil; cites 'twin goals'
content: India's external affairs ministry clarified that the nation's oil import policies prioritize consumer interests amidst a volatile energy market. While discussions on deepening energy cooperation with the US are ongoing, New Delhi maintains its strategy of broad-basing and diversifying energy sources to ensure stable prices and secure supplies, a stance reiterated by the MEA spokesperson.

title: When SNL's Colin Jost 'turned up' in Epstein video with Donald Trump
content: During Saturday Night Live's "Weekend Update," Michael Che used OpenAI's Sora to insert Colin Jost into a 1992 video of Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein. The doctored footage showed Jost dancing at the party, much to his visible discomfort and the audience's amusement. This stunt highlights AI's growing role in satire, blurring lines between reality and fabrication.

title: Watch: Bengaluru traffic police officer slaps man during routine check
content: A Bengaluru police officer faces suspension following a viral video. The footage shows the officer slapping a motorcyclist during a routine traffic stop. The incident has ignited public outcry on social media. Many are demanding accountability for the alleged abuse of power. An internal inquiry is now underway to investigate the matter thoroughly.

title: TVS Apache RTX 300 launched at Rs 1.99 lakh: Engine specs, features & more
content: TVS Motor Company has launched the Apache RTX 300, entering the adventure touring segment with prices starting at Rs 1.99 lakh. This new model features a 299.1 cc liquid-cooled engine, WP suspension, and four riding modes, including Rally. Bookings are open, with deliveries commencing November 15.

title: Charlie Kirk sculpture showing Jesus embracing him trolled
content: Ave Maria University will soon feature a new sculpture of Jesus Christ embracing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, inspired by his recent death. Canadian artist Timothy Schmalz created the piece, which is expected to join the university's permanent collection next year.

title: IAS officer suicide case: 8-day impasse ends, daughters cremate ADGP Puran Kumar
content: Eight days after IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's death, his family consented to a postmortem following assurances of a fair probe. His daughters performed the last rites. Meanwhile, ASI Sandeep, who investigated Kumar, also died by suicide. His family demanded an FIR before agreeing to an autopsy, receiving assurances from the Haryana CM.

title: ‚ÄòHurt by situation‚Äô: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan seeks parole to mediate Afghanistan tensions
content: Imran Khan, currently imprisoned, has reportedly sought parole to mediate escalating border tensions between Pakistan and Taliban-controlled Afghanistan. His sister revealed his deep concern over recent clashes and his offer to facilitate peaceful negotiations. The former PM faces multiple charges while violence flares along the Durand Line, causing casualties and territorial disputes.

title: Shoe-throwing bid at CJI: AG nods for contempt plea; curb on social media posts sought
content: Contempt proceedings are set to begin against lawyer Rakesh Kishore. This follows his shoe-throwing attempt at Chief Justice BR Gavai. The Supreme Court Bar Association sought to curb social media's coverage of the incident. Justices expressed concern over the court's time being diverted. They noted that action might further fuel the controversy.

title: World‚Äôs most powerful passports: India falls, US drops out of top 10 - check list
content: India's passport ranking has slipped to 85th in the 2025 Henley Passport Index, offering visa-free access to 57 destinations. This marks a decline from its previous position. Singapore leads the index with access to 193 countries, followed by South Korea and Japan. Several European nations also feature prominently in the top rankings.

title: Powerful earthquake in Indonesia: 6.7 magnitude quake hits Papua
content: A powerful 6.7 magnitude earthquake jolted Papua province in Indonesia on Thursday, according to the USGS. The tremor occurred at a depth of 70 kilometers, with its epicenter located approximately 200 kilometers from Abepura city. Fortunately, no tsunami warning was issued following the seismic event.

title: IPL: Kane Williamson joins LSG; welcomed by owner Sanjiv Goenka
content: Kane Williamson has been appointed as the new Strategic Advisor for the Lucknow Super Giants ahead of IPL 2026. The franchise aims to rebuild after a disappointing 2025 season. Williamson's leadership and strategic acumen are expected to be crucial in shaping the team's future.

title: 'Hard but necessary decision': Nestle to cut 16,000 jobs globally
content: Nestl√© plans to cut 16,000 jobs globally over two years, with 12,000 white-collar roles targeted to save one billion Swiss francs. This aggressive cost-saving measure, aiming for three billion Swiss francs in savings by 2027, follows a recent leadership shake-up and a bottled water scandal, as the company navigates slowing growth and declining sales.

title: Chandigarh horror: Speeding Thar kills woman, sister critical
content: A speeding Mahindra Thar tragically killed one sister and critically injured another in Chandigarh's Sector 46. The 22-year-old victim, Sojef, was studying at Dev Samaj College. The vehicle fled the scene, and police are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the driver, who is yet to be apprehended.

title: 'We lack pride': Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw blasts Bengaluru garbage problem
content: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw criticized Bengaluru's persistent garbage problem, calling it a "serious malaise" and blaming past governments' inaction. Her remarks drew criticism from Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar, who accused her of tarnishing the state, while Bengaluru residents rallied behind Shaw, demanding accountability for civic infrastructure.

title: Andhra Pradesh woman raped, robbed at knifepoint on moving train in Telangana
content: In a shocking violation of safety, a 25-year-old woman faced a horrific ordeal aboard the Santragachi Special Express. Traveling solo from Rajahmundry to Hyderabad, she was assaulted in a ladies' compartment while en route between Guntur and Pedakurapadu stations.

title: N-words, rape jokes and ‚ÄòI love Hitler‚Äô: Leaked Republican group chat
content: Leaked Telegram chats reveal shocking racist, antisemitic, and violent rhetoric from young Republican leaders across multiple states. Messages included Nazi references, racial slurs, and threats. Some accused individuals have apologized, while others faced consequences, sparking outrage within the GOP and calls for accountability.

title: ‚ÄòRespected scholar‚Äô: Indian-origin US expert Ashley Tellis denies espionage charges
content: Prominent Indian-origin scholar Ashley Tellis, a former Bush administration official, has been arrested by the FBI on charges of retaining classified documents and meeting with Chinese officials. His lawyers vehemently deny the allegations, stating Tellis is a respected advisor and will contest any claims of acting for a foreign adversary.

title: This Bihar Bahubali Has A PhD. His Son Will Contest Election This Time
content: The converging worlds of crime and politics have produced some well-known politicians in Bihar. But Sunil Pandey brought more to the table. A strongman with a doctoral degree, he was a former MLA from Bhojpur district with four election victories.

title: Elvish Yadav, Singer Fazilpuria Face Probe Agency Heat Over Snake Videos
content: YouTuber Elvish Yadav and Haryanvi singer Rahul Yadav alias Rahul Fazilpuria have been charged by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a money laundering case linked to the use of protected wildlife in their videos.

title: India Responds To Trump's Claim That PM Modi Made A Russian Oil Promise
content: India's consistent priority is to safeguard the interests of the Indian consumer in a volatile energy scenario, New Delhi has said in response to US President Donald Trump's claim

title: This Asian Diplomat Once Rejected The Nobel Peace Prize
content: In 1973, Le Duc Tho and Henry Kissinger were nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize, two days after the signing of the Paris Accords.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Who Moved My Tech?
content: The business of technology has rewired the very logic of market behaviour, rewarding first movers and creation of dependencies more than even revenue and returns.

title: "Can't Defend Themselves": Father Of AI-171 Pilot Approaches Supreme Court
content: Four months after the AI-171 plane crash in Ahmedabad left 260 people dead, the father of the pilot, the late Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, has approached the Supreme Court, seeking a judicially monitored probe into the crash.

title: Aaron Chatterji At NDTV World Summit: Meet OpenAI's 1st Chief Economist
content: Aaron "Ronnie" Chatterji, OpenAI's first Chief Economist, is attending the NDTV World Summitin New Delhi.

title: Nick Booker, Co-Founder Of IndoGenius, To Attend NDTV World Summit
content: Nick Booker, the co-founder at IndoGenius, will be among the attendees and speakers at the NDTV World Summit in New Delhi.

title: Who Is Nitin Mittal, Deloitte Principal And WSJ's Bestselling Author Set To Attend NDTV World Summit
content: Nitin Mittal, Deloitte Principal, Global AI Leader, and author of the WSJ bestseller All-in on AI, is among the leaders attending the NDTV World Summit.

title: Gautam Singhania To Attend NDTV World Summit 2025: All About Raymond Chairman
content: Gautam Singhania, Chairman of Raymond Group, is among the industry leaders attending the NDTV World Summit 2025 in New Delhi.

title: Meet Mastercard South Asia Head Gautam Aggarwal, Who Will Speak At NDTV World Summit
content: Gautam Aggarwal, Mastercard's Division President of South Asia, is set to attend the 2025 NDTV World Summit on October 17.

title: Dead Pigeons In Well: Contaminated Water Makes 60 Sick In Madhya Pradesh
content: Several people fell ill after consuming contaminated water from a well in Chhindwara's Rajola village, Madhya Pradesh, Sub Divisional Magistrate Chhindwara, Hemkaran Dhruve, said.

title: Video: Tanks Race On Afghan Streets. Taliban Says It Captured Them From Pakistan Forces
content: Hours before Islamabad and Kabul agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire, videos went viral on social media showing tanks racing through the streets of Afghanistan's southeastern Spin Boldak province.

title: Air India Rolls Out 174 Extra Flights Ahead Of Winter Travel Season
content: Air India has announced the addition of 174 weekly flights on major domestic and short-haul international routes, beginning October 26, 2025, as part of its "Northern Winter Schedule."

title: Meet Anne Aly, Australian Minister Set To Attend NDTV World Summit
content: Australia's Cabinet Minister Anne Aly has landed in India as part of the Anthony Albanese government's efforts to deepen ties across the Indian Ocean region.

title: "Need To Change Faster": Nestle To Cut 16,000 Jobs Over Next 2 Years
content: Nestle, the Swiss food and beverage giant known for brands like Nespresso, Kit Kat, Perrier, and Purina, announced on Thursday that it will cut 16,000 jobs worldwide over the next two years.

title: Odisha Man Poses As Maoist To Extort Rs 35 Lakh From Father, Arrested
content: In a shocking case, a 24-year-old young man was arrested on charges of attempting to dupe his father by posing as a fake Maoist and demanding Rs 35 lakh as extortion in Odisha's Kalahandi district, police said.

title: In Nitish Kumar's Bihar List, A Muslim Balancing Act, And Caste Equation Play
content: Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's Janata Dal United (JDU) has fielded Muslim candidates in four seats for the 2025 Bihar assembly elections, carefully balancing caste equations with community vote banks in the politically sensitive state.

title: 'Look Forward To Meeting PM Modi At NDTV World Summit': Sri Lankan PM
content: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya is "excited" to participate in the NDTV World Summit tomorrow at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. The Summit, to be held on 17th and 18th October, is a global conversation of immense consequence.

title: IndiGo And Digi Yatra Partner To Enable Paperless, Biometric Boarding
content: IndiGo and Digi Yatra have completed an app-to-app integration enabling seamless sharing of boarding passes between their respective mobile applications.

content: ESPN's Laurence Edmondson lays out the possibility of Max Verstappen making a late run for the drivers' championship . the weekend is set to be hot and sunny with temperatures above 30¬∞C (86¬∞F) Saturday is expected to peak at 34¬∞C, giving the drivers another heat test after Singapore .

content: the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Mariners 13-4 in game 3 of the American League Championship Series . a barrage of home runs led to a dominant 13-4 victory over the blue Jays . the series leads the series to 2-1 after the blues dropped the first two games at home .

title: Pochettino's turnaround has USMNT no longer dreading World Cup
content: Mauricio pochettino's men's national team won 2-1 against australia . the results have improved to the point that the team is unbeaten in its past three games . there is competition for places everywhere on the field .

title: Vintage duel: Joe Flacco vs. Aaron Rodgers is a historic battle of QBs 40 and older
content: the two starting quarterbacks have a rare opportunity to keep playing at an advanced age . they will be just the second quarterback pairing in the Super Bowl era to start against each other . the two quarterbacks will be the second in the super bowl to start each other as 40-year-ol .
